title: @Meddler - The Shen nerfs really need to stop.
body:
Really, if you guys are having this much trouble with his ultimate playing too much of a role in pro-games, why not simply nerf the ability itself? Instead you decide to nerf his potential as a solo-laner which goes against everything you've contemplated a couple of weeks ago.

The guy already received MASSIVE nerfs to his only offensive ability before (he lost part of his damage, sustain and slow on his Q) and now you're even nerfing his capability to tank damage (see his latest passive changes on the PBE). In his current state he's literally just an ult-bot, and even that ability comes with a huge price - usually the loss of his tower the moment he leaves lane to help someone. And don't get me started on his complete lack of waveclear, he's just extremely dull to play as.

Wasn't your original plan to give him some more laning power while increasing the cooldown of his ultimate? He's already a very weak solo-laner (just look at his Solo Q performance) and yet you feel inclined to balance the game for an extreme minority that apparently knows how to make this sad excuse for a ninja work.

How about you finally fix his taunt-hitbox? His model can collide with the opponent and yet the effect simply won't go off, that shouldn't even be possible.

Hey guys, wanted to update you all:

We are pulling the nerfs to Shen for 7.6. Thank you guys for the feedback.  It's apparent that larger scope changes are required to address the pain points you guys have brought up. Future large-scope work on Shen will most likely be in the direction of re-shaping his holistic kit to lessen the discrepancy of performance between live ranked and pro play. Things like Shadow Dash width/range are on the table for exploration as well in that world.

If we need to make buff/nerfs to him before a larger set of changes can ship, we will strive to select changes that will push Shen towards the direction that manifests the strengths and weaknesses we intended for him. When champions require larger scope work to solve, we try to make sure that necessary short term changes provide a better foundation for future work.
Wait are we getting another Shen rework?
Don't worry it's another Ryze rework in disguise.

Oh my god yes. As a low ELO player with almost 300k on Shen, repeatedly hitting his lane power really started to hurt. Why play a high skill floor champion for mediocre results when I could just Yorick and win on CS alone? 

To suggest/note a few things:
- Giving recipient-side enemies a way to combat his ult would probably be one of the most effective ways to just kill him in pro play, but keep him functional in soloQ. i.e. the ult gets canceled when the shield breaks, not just when the recipient dies. A more narrower but more reliable interrupt condition (like it breaks when charmed or feared) would probably be a more nuanced way to do it, since it makes counter-picking Shen in competitive a more legitimate strategy. 
- I hate his W from a game health perspective. It's absurdly powerful vs auto attackers and worthless vs abilities (can't be helping the competitive marksmen situation). I'd prefer a more consistent defensive skill with actual scalings, if only so I could blind pick Shen more consistently.     
- I think incentivizing CDR more would be a good way to reduce his consistent power in pro play, while making his amateur play a little more impactful/fun (basically reducing ult uptime and increasing core kit uptime). 
- Shen's got maybe the most limited (competitive) itemization in the game. Broadening the items he can meaningfully pick would help make his balancing less volatile/painful.

I'd love to see the shyvanna-scale rework team give him a once over. I don't think he needs a full rework, but he definitely needs some actual dev time, vs "High pick rate in competitive, so nerf him again".

Couple of things - Galio's new ult isn't global nor does it provide a shield to the ally. His ult can go from about inhibitor turret over to the outermost tower. His ult grants his ally the MR/AR bonus he gets from his new W, but it is NOT a shield. A shield can be popped off easily later in the game, DR is more effective, It reminds me of how Annie's E basic ability is a better version of Jax Ult.

Few reasons why we aren't hitting R right now to target pro-play considerations:

- Despite R being powerful in pro, any nerf we do to it will also hit normal play a good chunk as well
- Updated Galio is about to hit Live and will contend with Shen's strategic space somewhat, would like to observe and figure out a better direction once we see how these two champs interact in terms of priority

Given his normal play performance and priority in pro, my inclination is that we'd rather nerf Shen for pro-play by buffing the champions that are meant to deal with him over hitting him directly. (Some cool trends are in effect though, like Renekton bubbling up etc.) Thus we felt a lighter nerf on him this time around was more appropriate.  The nerfs we are trying for 7.6 are aimed at his late game dueling potential, something that I believe stands to be weaker than other parts of his kit given his powerful global presence in the late game. At the same time, our PBE changes are a slight buff to his early laning, not a large one but it definitely can be meaningful in extended trades in the early game. Historically, Shen has been strategically countered by a late game duelist who could lane against him throughout the game. The nerfs on PBE are intended to push him slightly more towards that historical weakness.

Galio is nothing else but a "better Shen", I don't see how nerfing the ninja is going to do Shen any favors in that comparison.

Galio's ability to reduce damage while jumping into the battle at a far shorter amount of time (it's merely ONE second!) without even getting his ult canceled due to his target dying during the channel only makes him so much better. Meanwhile Shen's targets die far too quickly before he even gets a chance to tp to them, his shield is just too pitiful. 

**And when will you finally address his terrible taunt-hitbox?** At least give him some compensation for what you're about to do to him. His energy costs are probably the highest in the entire game and just missing your taunt removes any threat he could ever pose to be. He is too dependent on hitting an inaccurate ability and **the time it takes for him to regain that energy is downright absurd compared to someone like Lee**. 

**Speaking of inaccurate abilities, in general you have far too little control on when to make use of his passive shield since it already pops when you try to lasthit in lane**, there's no conscious use of the ability at all. During battle you simply spam his abilities in hopes of even triggering the thing, there's no calculation going on.

**He really could use another rework**, he's just extremely boring and too underpowered to play as. Most of all, Shen desperately needs some waveclear in his kit if you expect him to be a decent top-laner at all. **In his current state he's just a tank/support hybrid who doesn't excel at either role. He's a total mess.**
